InteractionDesign.Group3

Class WeatherCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • InteractionDesign.Group3.WeatherCache

  • public class WeatherCache
extends java.lang.Object
    A cache of the most recently loaded weather data. This acts as an interface between the frontend and the API. The cache is saved to disk, so that is can be reloaded later. This is a singleton. When instantiated, the cache is loaded from disk if a cache file already exists.

    • Method Detail

      • getCache

        public static WeatherCache getCache()
                             throws APIException,
                                    CacheException
        Returns the singleton instance of WeatherData. After this call, the cache will have up to date weather data, unless an exception is thrown.
        Returns:
        the singleton
        Throws:
        APIException - if fetching weather data from the API fails
        CacheException - if the cache file is invalid

                                     CacheException
        Gets a list of recommended items based on two time stamps and the daily forecast. Not yet implemented...
        Parameters:
        start - the first time stamp
        fin - the second time stamp
        Returns:
        a list of Items
        Throws:
        APIException - if fetching weather data from the API fails
        CacheException - if the cache file is invalid

      • getSearchSuggestions

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSearchSuggestions(java.lang.String s)
        Recommends cities given the start of a city name. The input is case-insensitive. Returns null if the input is less than 3 characters. The value returned is of the form [city name], [ISO 3166 country code]
        Parameters:
        s - the beginning of a city name
        Returns:
        a list of cities matching the request

                  throws APIException,

        Returns:

        Throws:

        CacheException - if the cache file is invalid

      • getThisWeek

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<Record>> getThisWeek()
                                                   throws APIException,
                                                          CacheException
        Gets the 5 day forecast. Each element in the list is the forecast for one day. Each day is a list of record with forecast every 3 hours. Every record has a time stamp, and the lists are sorted chronologically.
        Returns:
        the forecast for each day of the week
        Throws:
        APIException - if fetching weather data from the API fails
        CacheException - if the cache file is invalid

      • getToday

        public java.util.List<Record> getToday()
                                throws APIException,
                                       CacheException
        Gets the forecast for today. Each record gives weather data for a particular time, as well as a time stamp. Records are 3 hours apart. The list is ordered chronolgically.
        Returns:
        daily weather forecast
        Throws:
        APIException - if fetching weather data from the API fails
        CacheException - if the cache file is invalid

        Returns:

        Throws:

        Parameters:

        CacheException - if saving to disk fails
